caption.p: Combinations of antifungal agents tested for M. mycetomatis

fn.p:
bThe interaction ratio (IR) was calculated with the following formula:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}$IR\ = \ \frac{{{I_o}}}{{{I_e}}}$\end{document} , where I o is considered the observed percentage of inhibition and I e is the expected percentage of inhibition for a certain combination. I e is calculated as follows:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}${I_e} = \ A + B - ( {\frac{{AB}}{{100}}} )$\end{document} , where A and B are the inhibition observed for compounds A and B alone. An IR >1.5 is considered synergistic (S), an IR between 0.5 and 1.5 is indifferent (I) and an IR <0.5 is antagonistic (A).
